intro: Hedysarum oliveri, commonly known as Oliver's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It produces pods that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution in suitable soils. Hedysarum oliveri plays a role in nitrogen fixation, enhancing soil fertility in its native range.
